body:
This also happens for this code:

```python
import typing
def test(x: typing.Literal['sys']) -> int:
    ...
```
I'd like to give it a shot if possible

issue.title: [Fix #11222] Preserve string arguments in annotations
issue.body:
### Description
Fixes #11222 

This PR attempts to fix the issue in the annotations by preserving quotes on string arguments when they are converted to a single string

## Test Plan
I added the following test:
```
[case testPreserveFunctionAnnotationWithArgs]
def f(x: foo['x']) -> bar: ...
def g(x: foo[x]) -> bar: ...
def h(x: foo['x', 'y']) -> bar: ...
def i(x: foo[x, y]) -> bar: ...
def j(x: foo['x', y]) -> bar: ...
def k(x: foo[x, 'y']) -> bar: ...
def lit_str(x: Literal['str']) -> Literal['str']: ...
def lit_int(x: Literal[1]) -> Literal[1]: ...
[out]
def f(x: foo['x']) -> bar: ...
def g(x: foo[x]) -> bar: ...
def h(x: foo['x', 'y']) -> bar: ...
def i(x: foo[x, y]) -> bar: ...
def j(x: foo['x', y]) -> bar: ...
def k(x: foo[x, 'y']) -> bar: ...
def lit_str(x: Literal['str']) -> Literal['str']: ...
def lit_int(x: Literal[1]) -> Literal[1]: ...
```

body: is the issue still open? If yes I want to try it (I am pretty new to open source contribution)

@Infinil there's a PR for this already: https://github.com/python/mypy/pull/11292

Feel free to choose any other issue. If you need help, just ping me and ask your question. I will try to anwser it ðŸ™‚

@sobolevn 
I made 2 commits a while ago but I was quite confused by test cases etc so I didnt add any ðŸ˜¥.. can you help me with test cases if you dont mind..
@Infinil which commits? Can you please provide a link?

Hi @Infinil, mypy is unfortunately not the easiest codebase to get started with; I have somehow become a maintainer and much of the codebase is a mystery to me too (which is part of why I don't merge that many PRs).

I'd recommend starting out with a simpler subsystem like stubgen, or perhaps try to make some contributions to typeshed (https://github.com/python/typeshed), which tends to be a bit simpler.

I am on the #type-hinting channel on PyDis (https://www.pythondiscord.com/). A few of us also use Gitter at https://gitter.im/python/typing.
